conclusion: To solve the problem, I will analyze the forces acting on the wooden block and the long wooden board. I will calculate the frictional forces involved and determine the magnitude of the frictional force exerted by the ground on the long wooden board.

The image shows a wooden block labeled P of mass m sliding on a long wooden board labeled ab of mass M. The setup is on a horizontal ground. The block P is moving to the right, and the board ab remains stationary. The coefficients of kinetic friction are given as μ1 for the board on the ground and μ2 for the block on the board.

premise: The block P is moving to the right with a velocity v.
conclusion: There is a frictional force F_{P on ab} acting on the block from the board, opposing its motion.
The frictional force F_{ab on P} from the block equals the frictional force F_{ground on ab} from the ground.
The frictional force F_{ab on P} is given by μ2 mg, where m is the mass of the block and g is the acceleration due to gravity.
The frictional force F_{ground on ab} is given by μ1 Mg, where M is the mass of the board.

premise: Since the board is stationary, F_{ab on P} = F_{ground on ab}.

conclusion: Solving for μ1, we find μ1 = (m/M) μ2.

premise: The magnitude of the frictional force exerted by the ground on the board is μ1 Mg = (m/M) μ2 Mg.
